intro: Lessertia frutescens, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for gardens in Mediterranean climates. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
